channel.title: Login and then dc insantly
channel.description: Im using stingazz source and every client u try to login with u can like see the invy and stuff then dc. I know this problem is server sided so the coder of the source had so you could only login from 1 client but how do i change?

item.title: Login and then dc insantly
item.dc:creator: @Mental_Piracy Mental Piracy
item.description:
@Mental_Piracy wrote:

[quote=“SirPali, post:11, topic:328981”][quote author=Mental Piracy link=topic=425366.msg3124022#msg3124022 date=1265844037]
A t2 error on login either means a custom interface is loaded, custom sidebars are loaded, or another type of custom item object appears when server starts.
[/quote]

Hmm. I used to get them when I picked up / equiped and item that didn’t exist, or when putting non-existant / too many items in a shop. Had the same symptoms as marc is experiencing.
Thats why I mentioned T2 are hard-to-solve errors, lot’s of things can trigger them.[/quote]
Yeah but for the most part if it happens on character login its one of the things i posted. It can be fixed given the proper time. If he wanted it, which by the above post he doesnt, i could of helped him find it. Its the reason any source dl should come with a client. No telling who has fucked it up.

Read full topic

item.title: Login and then dc insantly
item.dc:creator: @SirPali SirPali
item.description:
@SirPali wrote:

Mental Piracy:

A t2 error on login either means a custom interface is loaded, custom sidebars are loaded, or another type of custom item object appears when server starts.

Hmm. I used to get them when I picked up / equiped and item that didn’t exist, or when putting non-existant / too many items in a shop. Had the same symptoms as marc is experiencing.
Thats why I mentioned T2 are hard-to-solve errors, lot’s of things can trigger them.

Read full topic

item.title: Login and then dc insantly
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

na its not worth the time of anyone to fix

Read full topic

item.title: Login and then dc insantly
item.dc:creator: @Mental_Piracy Mental Piracy
item.description:
@Mental_Piracy wrote:

[quote=“marcbob, post:8, topic:328981”][quote author=SirPali link=topic=425366.msg3124013#msg3124013 date=1265843477]
Foobar’d = F*cked up beyond all repair.
I’m guessing one of your starter items (backpack or already equiped) is using an ID that doesn’t exist. That’s one of the things to could cause a T2.
T2’s are very hard to solve, cause they don’t say where the error occurs.
Anyway, if i were you, i’d check my starter items.
[/quote]

ya fuck this source i only liked it because it has targets in the wildy and ep so whatever[/quote]
A t2 error on login either means a custom interface is loaded, custom sidebars are loaded, or another type of custom item object appears when server starts. Check your initialize method in client.java and post it for me please. I can tell you what to weed out if you really want that source.

Read full topic

I’m guessing one of your starter items (backpack or already equiped) is using an ID that doesn’t exist. That’s one of the things to could cause a T2.
T2’s are very hard to solve, cause they don’t say where the error occurs.
Anyway, if i were you, i’d check my starter items.[/quote]

item.title: Login and then dc insantly
item.dc:creator: @SirPali SirPali
item.description:
@SirPali wrote:

Foobar’d = F*cked up beyond all repair.
I’m guessing one of your starter items (backpack or already equiped) is using an ID that doesn’t exist. That’s one of the things to could cause a T2.
T2’s are very hard to solve, cause they don’t say where the error occurs.
Anyway, if i were you, i’d check my starter items.

item.title: Login and then dc insantly
item.dc:creator: @SirPali SirPali
item.description:
@SirPali wrote:

[quote=“marcbob, post:4, topic:328981”]Error: T2 - 208,-1,-1 - 2,0,0 - 80,70,
urlstream[/quote]

Congratulations, it seems your source has been foobar’d.
Did you add ANYTHING before this error started happening?
Does it happen on all chars?

Read full topic
